Name: Akira
Description: Authentic Japanese cuisine with fresh sushi, ramen, and izakaya dishes. Chef-owned with seasonal specials.
Parking: Street parking, nearby lot at Soquel & Front
Tips: Sit at the sushi bar for the freshest selections. Make reservations for dinner.

Name: The Picnic Basket
Description: Farm-to-table café with incredible sandwiches, salads, and baked goods. Secret garden patio out back!
Parking: Metered street parking, Beach St lot
Tips: Ask to sit in the secret garden patio out back! Get there early on weekends.

Name: Tacos Moreno
Description: The best breakfast burritos in Santa Cruz. Cash only, locals line up every morning at their truck locations.
Tips: Cash only! They sell out by 11am. Follow on Instagram for daily locations. Worth any wait.

Name: Lúpulo Craft Beer House
Description: Gastropub with 24 rotating craft beers and elevated pub food. Trivia every Thursday.
Tips: Thursday trivia at 7pm is always packed. Great happy hour 3-6pm weekdays.

Name: Betty's Noodles
Description: Local favorite for pad thai, pho, and Asian fusion. Huge portions, always fresh.
Tips: Cash only! Portions are huge - consider sharing. Always a wait during dinner rush.

Name: La Posta
Description: Authentic Mexican cuisine with amazing moles and traditional dishes. Family recipes.
Parking: Street parking, small lot in back
Tips: Try the mole - made fresh daily. Weekend brunch is special. Great margaritas!

Name: Saturn Cafe
Description: 24/7 vegetarian diner with vegan options. Retro space-themed décor and creative comfort food.
Tips: Open 24 hours! Great for late-night munchies. Everything can be made vegan.

Name: Bantam
Description: Wood-fired pizza and seasonal small plates. Farm-to-table with constantly changing menu.
Tips: Make reservations! Small space fills up fast. Happy hour pizza deals are excellent.

Name: El Palomar
Description: Downtown landmark since 1980. Fresh Mexican food, famous margaritas, and rooftop patio.
Tips: Rooftop patio is the best spot in summer. Margaritas are legendary. Can get touristy on weekends.

Name: Penny Ice Creamery
Description: Small-batch ice cream made with local, organic ingredients. Creative flavors that rotate daily.
Tips: Flavors change daily based on what's fresh. Always a line but it moves quickly. Worth it.
